page.title: 18OUR LOCAL NEWSPAPER(cont)
page.content:
The paper is delivered free, but it depends on people making subscriptions every year. There are 1250 copies produced monthly, but only 950 are actually delivered. The other 300 are taken to the shops and libraries. It costs about Â£160 a month to produce, and was chosen in 1983 as the best local newspaper in Gloucestershire. Here is an extract from the Painswick Beacon of December 1984:
"PAID UP PROMISES The Painswick Tennis Club Promises Auction, which took place on Saturday 10th November in Painswick House, raised Â£1,240 in promises alone. When gate money, bar and donations are taken into account, overÂ£1,300 will have been received, making it a most successful evening - and all the promises paid up! Well over 100 people
